title: Quantum Benchmarking Instance File Schema
description: Describes required fields for a valid benchmark instance file.

benchmark_instance_uuid.title: Benchmark Instance UUID
benchmark_instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the benchmark instance as a string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format to the second.

calendar_due_date.title: Calendar Due Date
calendar_due_date.description:
For competitions and ad hoc evaluations this may be set so that the benchmark performer must return a solution by the due date (down to the second).  The value is a string with a timestamp in ISO 8601 format to the second.

 If there is no due date, it is set to `null`.

short_name.title: Short Name
short_name.description: A short string.  Not necessarily unique.

other_info.title: Other Information
other_info.description: An optional object with no required structure for the test performer to put other contact information or comments in.

superseded_by.title: Successor Test Procedure
superseded_by.description:
If this benchmark instance is status:deprecated, this field lists the UUID of the successor test_procedure object.
If this test_procedure is NOT deprecated, then the value is set to null.

benchmark_type.title: Benchmark Type
benchmark_type.description:
Choose from the following:

GSEE
QUANTUM_DYNAMICS
DIFFERENTIAL_EQUATIONS
OTHER

application_domain.title: Application Domain
application_domain.description:
Domain of the Benchmark Instance.  Choose from the following:

CM: Condense Matter
QC: Quantum Chemistry
QB: Quantum Biochemistry
BIO: Biology/Biomedical
ENG: Engineering
FLP: Fluids/Plasmas
OPT: Optimization
DML: Data and Machine Learning
HEP: High-Energy and Fundamental Physics

instance_data.title: Instance Data
instance_data.description: A list of objects describing the required data.  Exact structure is TDB.  For large instances, a URL to the data is given.

instance_features.title: Instance Features
instance_features.description: An object describing the features of the instance. E.g., basis set used for Hamiltonian creation, number of orbitals, etc.  Exact structure is TBD.
